content.description: The weekly sales at two movie theaters were recorded for a random sample of 25 weeks. A 95 percent confidence interval for the difference in mean weekly sales for the two movie theaters was calculated as <math alttext="1,288 dollars comma 2,586 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>1</mn><mtext>,288,$2</mtext><mtext>,586</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: With all else remaining constant, which of the following would have resulted in a confidence interval narrower than the calculated interval?

topic.text: 7.7: Justifying a Claim About the Difference of Two Means Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Make an appropriate claim or draw an appropriate conclusion.
